#Text=Canada 's Toronto Centre ( Ward 28 )
#Text=city council candidates speak
#Text=Saturday , November 4 , 2006
#Text=On November 13 , Toronto residents will be heading to the polls to vote for their ward 's councillor and for mayor .
#Text=Among Toronto 's ridings is Toronto Centre ( Ward 28 ) .
#Text=One candidate responded to Wikinews ' requests for an interview .
#Text=This ward 's candidates include Howard Bortenstein , Holly Cartmell , Baquie Ghazi , Connie Harrison , Yaqoob Khan , Pam McConnell ( incumbent ) , and Catherina Perez .
#Text=For more information on the election , read Toronto municipal election , 2006 .
#Text=Howard Bortenstein
#Text=52-year-old Howard Bortenstein is the founder/owner of Miller Bortenstein Consultants , " a management consulting firm specializing in information technology strategy and change management . "

column1: #Text=Describe the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=There is a tremendous undertone of despair and apathy when people talk about the current situation of Ward 28 and the city in general .

#Text=I am deeply concerned about the downward spiral of our neighbourhoods : no vision , residents feel unsafe ; businesses struggling ; crumbling public housing ; no " at risk neighbourhoods ' youth funding and an absentee councillor battling windmills elsewhere , leaving the ward in auto-pilot .

column1: #Text=volunteer organization
#Text=What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?
#Text=Ward 28 faces serious social housing problems specifically Toronto Community Housing :
#Text=poor living conditions
#Text=crime
#Text=infestation
#Text=massive poverty
#Text=Residents from all neighbourhoods and all income levels share these concerns .
#Text=Tenants must have more options and flexibility to break the cycle of poverty and get back their dignity that has been taken from them .
#Text=Dramatic change from the current model of building " monuments to poverty " is required .

column1: #Text=Tenants need choice offered by portable housing allowances , to relocate closer to new job opportunities or schools anywhere in Toronto .
#Text=We must return Ward 28 to socio-economic diversity .
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Had anyone asked me a few years ago if I had any political aspirations , I would have thought they were nuts .
#Text=But a couple of years ago , when our then two year old daughter was put at risk by picking up a discarded condom in Riverdale Park , things changed .
#Text=So after the trauma of hepatitis injections and HIV screening at Sick Kids and fighting city hall to clean up the park
#Text=the question remained " How did this happen ? "
#Text=The simple answer is : " because we let it happen " .
#Text=We took it for granted that our local councillor was making the right choices to keep us safe and to improve the quality of life of all neighbourhoods and all residents .
#Text=Well , I found out the hard way that is n't true and I decided this needed to be changed .
#Text=Party politics are paralyzing City Council , literally crippling this city .
#Text=Asa
#Text=candidate , the question I receive most often is , " what is your political party ? "
#Text=I am not aligned or a member of any political party .
#Text=I am not an ideologue from the left or the right .
#Text=I believe in consensus , not compromise , and building bridges on issues from the centre .
#Text=Why do you want to represent this particular ward on council ?
#Text=I want my daughters to grow up in Cabbagetown .
#Text=I am tired of having their school-age friends leave the area for the suburbs .
#Text=Ward 28 has become an economically depressed area .
#Text=I have a bold vision for Ward 28 to restore ward 28 as a place of innovation and growth .
#Text=How are you currently involved in the community ?
#Text=I was a founding board member of the Don Vale Cabbagetown Residents Association which is now over 500 members .
#Text=I am also a member of the Community Police Liaison Committee , where I am working to broaden and increase neighbourhood membership in the committee via community outreach .
#Text=I am also a long time member and volunteer of the Cabbagetown Preservation Association , working to protect our remaining heritage properties .
#Text=If you were elected as a " rookie " councillor , What would you bring to the table beyond the incumbent ?

#Text=I will instil a sense of hope for everyone and build consensus around a vision , no matter what your individual political stripe , or neighbourhood you live in , that if we work together , we can change things around .
#Text=The residents of ward 28 are patient people and they deserve more than political rhetoric .
#Text=They want results not aspirations .
#Text=They want accountability from their elected representatives .
#Text=They want a councillor responsive to all residents , all businesses and all neighbourhoods !
#Text=I will be that councillor .
#Text=What does Toronto mean to you ?
#Text=I care very deeply for our downtown neighbourhoods and the city of Toronto .
#Text=I have lived in Downtown Toronto for twenty-five years including fourteen in Cabbagetown .
#Text=I have always liked living in Downtown Toronto .
#Text=This is not my Toronto and this is not the Toronto I want to leave as a legacy to my young daughters .
#Text=Bortenstein did not respond to the question " Which council decision ( since the 2003 election )
